Kim would be delighted if the Chinese came in and developed ANYTHING.  They don't need to "buy the cow", this one has hoof & mouth and produces zero milk anyway.

China does not want a War - they are already winning the Worlds Economic Wars & the Worlds Environmental Wars - Millions of New Jobs in China in the Renewable Energy Industry - 40,000 New Jobs in America under Trump in the Coal Mining - Any Conventional or Nuclear War is Counter-intuitive to China but they are more worried about a Loose Cannon Insecure Paranoid Bully like Trump then they are Kim jong un - Kim wants to stay in power - attacking the USA in any form is going to end that forever and he knows that.......................

China does not want "control" politically of the Korean Peninsula. They want America out of Korea, free trading with Korea, and isolation of Japan from Asia. The Koreans and the Chinese despise the Japanese.

Russia just wants chaos and destabilization... with no goal other than making money.

Only China can prevent a shooting war.

Ask yourself .... if North Korea launches a short range nuke against South Korea, or Japan.... does that loss of life make it "acceptable" to THEN shoot back? or is it in everyone's best interest to make sure that never happens and save lives?

How long can the world tolerate the clear and present danger from the North Koreans?

Libs are experts at Godwin's Law

@Fishslayer777 Link: /t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/13210188 wrote: Is there anyone who doesn't believe we're gonna have a another shooting war with North Korea? If no shots are fired it's because of China. It may be the Chinese who take the first shot. My plausible guess (cloudy crystal ball) is the Chinese intervene against Kim by cutting off the money and supplies in a coordinated effort to end this. The rapid coup is support by China. Shots fired but not many. The "deal" is ......... South Korea takes over the north, all of Korea demilitarizes, Americans leave Korea, no missile defense provided "to" Japan, America supports reunification of Tiawan to mainland China, and no opposition to the island development in the south china sea. Nothing good will come out of this, as it stands today. It is untenable situation. Only China can end this drama peacefully.

I do not believe we will have another shooting war with North Korea (unless Trump wakes up grumpy one morning).  

Kim keeps increasing his nuclear capability because it is easy and keeps all the other powers at bay. China makes money off North Korea and does not want to adopt millions of uneducated, brainwashed, civilians to acquire a few million acres of farmland and a few million starving peasants. Trump is abandoning the leadership of the rest of Asia to China so what is the upside to acquiring this backward kingdom?  Better cabbage?

Re: CAN YOU BLAME KIM JONG UN?????

347 Views

Message 29 Link: /t5/Politics-Current-Events/CAN-YOU-BLAME-KIM-JONG-UN/m-p/1893013#M753811 of 44

‎08-10-2017 09:44 PM

@TxGrandpa2 Link: /t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/539403 wrote:
@Fishslayer777 Link: /t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/13210188 wrote: ......... South Korea takes over the north, all of Korea demilitarizes,

The scenario I've heard is that China is looking for removal of Kim, the fall of the government and they move in.  They've always wanted an outlet to the Sea of Japan.  They still have Russia to contend with.  But China is the key to all this.

I have to say that is the opposite of what I have heard. China has no interest in adopting a kingdom out of the worst of the middle ages with a population starving to the point of making tree bark soup and a level of technology barely above the horse and carriage.  Probably below that as they would eat the horse. Yes, they have 20 nukes but the worry is that they might be destroyed or launched before China could take them. Ever think of the easiest way to destroy a nuke?  They are quite capable of killing the entire population of North Korea and moving in but.............for some farmland?  Seriously? 

China is the answer but acquiring North Korea is not the question.
